ratings.comment: Expects high level of economic knowledge coming into class with no warning beforehand.

Lectures were boring. Course description does not mention economics portion and he teaches it as though all students are experts. Tests count for a huge portion of the grade and are difficult. Grades were entered incorrectly online and misled students about their grades all semester. Disappointed to experience such a drastic drop before the final.
Mind the grade weights, tough exams that make up 75% of the course.

This class wasn't hard. I studied for the exams the day before, going through each lecture, the discussion notes, and skimming through the book chapters. Dr. Stiegart may be an incredibly boring lecturer, (skipped going to class) but he tells you everything you need to know to do well on his tests. Reading the textbook helps for clarity, good luck!

Quite possibly the worst teacher in UW-Madison. His lectures were dull. Half the time he did not know or understand what he was talking about. His exams are not representative of what you learn in class/discussion/book (even if you read it three times over.

Most of the time I felt like I had no idea what he was asking us to learn. There was a big disconnect between homework assignments, lectures and class readings. Also not a very captivating lecturer-- it was very easy to fall asleep.
GREAT teacher! Learned a lot and is clear about what Stiegert teaches

I disagree with the other comments, which I assume came from those who didn't do the assigned homework or readings that made the tests a breeze. Stiegert is a little blah in his teaching style but he was crystal clear in his expectations. I got an AB with minimal effort or studying, but would recommend flashcards to memorize terms before exams.

Ag Econ sucked, Stiegert wants you to take it in and make it your life. Basically the class sucked, the exams were death, he expects a 94% for an A, and he doesn't curve. And he doesn't let you see your tests after they're graded, so you have no idea which questions you got wrong. Pointless.
